member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.Classification.TMTagger.TagsChanged
member.summary: An event that occurs when the classification of a span of text has changed.
member.remarks: This event gets raised if a non-text change would affect the classification in some way, for example typing /* would cause the classification to change in C# without directly affecting the span.

member.returns: A list of ClassificationSpans that represent spans identified to be of this classification.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.EditorHelper.GetFirstAndLastLineFromSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan)
member.summary: Given a span, find the first and last line that are part of the span. NOTE: If the span ends in column zero, we back up to the previous line, to handle the case where the user used shift + down to select a bunch of lines. They probably don't want the last line commented in that case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationHelperService.RetrieveIndentationOptions(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.ITextBuffer,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the indentation options of the text editor.

Returns the amount of spaces that should be inserted at the beginning of the given line based on the result of an indentation computation. Depending on and an option integer representing the indentation size, this method will calculate how many white spaces should be placed at the beginning of the line.

Returns the amount of spaces that should be inserted at the beginning of the given line based on the result of an indentation computation. Depending on and an option integer representing the indentation size, this method will calculate how many white spaces should be placed at the beginning of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationHelperService.ShouldIgnoreIndentation(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the given indicates that the next line should not be indented, even if says differently.

Given a line in a text document, look for the first line above that: 1. Is not empty 2. Is within the range where the current language configuration applies. 3. Doesn't isn't the continuity of a string started on the line above. If no line matches these conditions, returns false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationHelperService.ScopeToLanguageConfigurationRange(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.ITextSnapshotLine)
member.summary: Given the range of a language configuration file and a line in the text document, truncates that line to the range of the language configuration. In other words, in an embedded language scenario, if there are multiple languages on one line, then this method will return a span that only contains the text that corresponds to the current language configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationType.NoChange
member.summary: Indicates the indentation should not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationType.InheritsFromLineAbove
member.summary: Indicates the indentation should be the same the line above.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationType.Indent
member.summary: Indicated the indentation should be incremented relatively to the line above.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationType.Outdent

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Editor.LanguageConfiguration.Indentation.IndentationType.Overwrite

member.summary: Determines whether there is a closing brace at the given position. If there is no language configuration, determines it by using pre-defined brackets pairs.

member.param: The position where an opening brace has initially been detected. Usually it corresponds to the caret position.
member.returns: A set of snapshot spans corresponding to the matching opening and closing braces to highlight.

members.member:
Given the position of a closing brace, search for its matching opening brace backward in the document.
///
The position where an closing brace has initially been detected. Usually it corresponds to the caret position.
A set of snapshot spans corresponding to the matching opening and closing braces to highlight.

member.summary: Describe what to do with the indentation.

member.summary: Describes text to be appended after the new line and after the indentation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.Folding
member.summary: Describes folding rules for a language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.Folding.OffSide
member.summary: Used by the indentation based strategy to decide whether empty lines belong to the previous or the next block. A language adheres to the off-side rule if blocks in that language are expressed by their indentation. See [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Off-side_rule) for more information. If not set, `false` is used and empty lines belong to the previous block.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.Folding.Markers
member.summary: Region markers used by the language.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.FoldingMarkers
member.summary: Describes language specific folding markers such as '#region' and '#endregion'. The start and end regexes will be tested against the contents of all lines and must be designed efficiently: - the regex should start with '^' - regexp flags (i, g) are ignored

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.ILanguageConfigurationService.GetLanguageConfigurationFromSnapshotPointAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the most appropriate for a .
member.remarks: This member is internal because implementation uses to map a locationin to a correct configuration of embedded languages. These types are specific to the VS Editor and we'd rather keep this API editor-agnostic.
member.param: The snapshot point for which to look up the .

Determines whether the method should give a chance to the tagger to compute tags before determining the best . Setting this parameter to true may improve accuracy of the result but can also cause a UI Delay. Please use this parameter carefully.
A cancellation token
member.returns: Returns a language configuration and the range it applies to in the document, or null if not found.

member.param: The snapshot span for which to look up the .

Determines whether the method should give a chance to the tagger to compute tags before determining the best . Setting this parameter to true may improve accuracy of the result but can also cause a UI Delay. Please use this parameter carefully.
A cancellation token
member.returns: Returns a language configuration and the range it applies to in the document, or null if not found.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentAction
member.summary: Describes what to do with the indentation when pressing Enter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentAction.None
member.summary: Insert new line and copy the previous line's indentation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentAction.Indent
member.summary: Insert new line and indent once (relative to the previous line's indentation).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentAction.IndentOutdent
member.summary: Insert two new lines: - the first one indented which will hold the cursor - the second one at the same indentation level

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentAction.Outdent
member.summary: Insert new line and outdent once (relative to the previous line's indentation).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentationRules.IncreaseIndentPattern
member.summary: If a line matches this pattern, then all the lines after it should be indented once (until another rule matches).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentationRules.DecreaseIndentPattern
member.summary: If a line matches this pattern, then all the lines after it should be unindented once (until another rule matches).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentationRules.IndentNextLinePattern
member.summary: If a line matches this pattern, then **only the next line** after it should be indented once.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.IndentationRules.UnIndentedLinePattern
member.summary: If a line matches this pattern, then its indentation should not be changed and it should not be evaluated against the other rules.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.ITMLanguageConfigurationServiceFactory
member.summary: Service for the creation or instantiation of the TextMate languages configuration service.

member.summary: Gets or creates a singleton TextMate languages configuration service.
member.remarks: If the already exists, the existing service is returned by this call.
member.param: Set of detected language configuration file path associated with a scope name.
Set of detected language configuration file path associated with a content type name.
member.returns: A new or existing .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract
member.summary: The language configuration interface defines the contract between extensions and various editor features, like automatic bracket insertion, automatic indentation etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.Comments
member.summary: The language's comment settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.Brackets
member.summary: The language's brackets. This configuration implicitly affects pressing Enter around these brackets.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.AutoClosingPairs
member.summary: The language's auto closing pairs. The 'close' character is automatically inserted with the 'open' character is typed. If not set, the configured brackets will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.AutoCloseBefore
member.summary: Defines what characters must be after the cursor for bracket or quote autoclosing to occur when using the \'languageDefined\' autoclosing setting. This is typically the set of characters which can not start an expression, such as whitespace, closing brackets, non-unary operators, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.SurroundingPairs
member.summary: \ The language's surrounding pairs. When the 'open' character is typed on a selection, the selected string is surrounded by the open and close characters.If not set, the autoclosing pairs settings will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.Folding
member.summary: The language's folding rules.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.WordPattern
member.summary: The language's word definition. If the language supports Unicode identifiers (e.g. JavaScript), it is preferable to provide a word definition that uses exclusion of known separators. e.g.: A regex that matches anything except known separators (and dot is allowed to occur in a floating point number): /(-?\d*\.\d\w*)|([^\`\~\!\@\#\%\^\&\*\(\)\-\=\+\[\{\]\}\\\|\;\:\'\"\,\.\%lt;\%gt;\/\?\s]+)/g

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.IndentationRules
member.summary: The language's indentation settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.LanguageConfigurationContract.OnEnterRules
member.summary: \ The language's rules to be evaluated when pressing Enter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.Impl.LanguageConfigurationBase.TryGetAccurateScopeTagsAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the list of tags available. If needed, this method will wait that the tagger compute tags. This method may provide a more accurate result than but still does not guarantee that tags will be accurate. It is possible that the tagger is working in background and that the current method timeout, which will result in returning tags doesn't reflect the best semantic state of the document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.LanguageConfiguration.Impl.LanguageConfigurationBase.GetScopeTagsSnapshot(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint)
member.summary: Gets the list of tags available at the given position at the moment when this method is called. This method does not guarantee that tags will be accurate. It is possible that the tagger is working in background and that the current available tags doesn't reflect the best semantic state of the document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.ITMParserFactory.CreateScopeSelector(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a scope selector for matching the given scope expression against scope hierarchies.
member.param: If true, caches results for quicker evaluation on subsequent calls.
member.returns: A instance that can be used for comparing to scope hierarchies.
member.remarks: The cache has no size limit, so caches should only be used in short lived contexts, such as a single full-document parse, and be allowed to get GC-ed after.

member.returns: A single collection containing the merged contents of each of the subcollections.

member.summary: Options for the TextMate languages parser.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.TMParserOptions.None
member.summary: No optional features are enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.TMParserOptions.EnableAbortThresholds
member.summary: Parsers should skip a line if it is too long or throw and abort the parse if a line takes too long to parse.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.BeginWhileSegmentState
member.summary: Indicates the segment state of a BeginWhileRule.
member.remarks: Begin While rules are composed of a series of segments such as: Begin -> None -> While -> None -> While -> None... This series always begins with Begin and then alternates While and End until the rule terminates. For more info on how BeginWhileRule operates, look at the baseline feature tests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.BeginWhileSegmentState.None
member.summary: Indicates that the BeginWhileRuleState containing this SegmentState is currently between segments. This happens when the parser has moved on to the line following a Begin or While, and has not yet found a Begin or While match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.BeginWhileSegmentState.Begin
member.summary: Indicates that the BeginWhileRuleState containing this SegmentState is currently within a Begin segment. This means that we are on the first line of the begin/while rule and have not yet reached the end of the current line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.BeginWhileSegmentState.While
member.summary: Indicates that the BeginWhileRuleState containing this SegmentState is currently within a While segment. This means that we are not on the first line of the begin/while rule and have not yet reached the end of the current line.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.LineState.ShortScopesAndSpans
member.summary: List of all scopes that start and end on this line. All spans are on the line's snapshot.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.MatchElement.Captures
member.summary: A list of the scopes for the captures associated with the scope.

remarks.para: This array is 0-index so [0] == scope for (0), etc.

member.summary: Converts regex designed for the UTF-8 version of Oniguruma to work with the UTF-16 API so we don't have to waste cycles converting the text of every document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Parser.Implementation.PlistExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for manipulating plist files. For the format of a plist file, refer to http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd.
member.remarks: Although the TextMate editor uses PLIST files to store the grammars, the actual PLIST parsing that is performed in the community implementation must not completely respect the Apple standard because TextMate preserves leading and trailing whitespace in PLIST values. This is particularly important in regular expressions where the absence of a space can cause a scope to not match.

member.summary: Gets the value associated with the as an object in a plist dict.
member.param: The key of the value to get.

if the key does not have a value element (bad plist format) or the value element does not match the value type (unexpected value type).

member.summary: Evaluates an atomic scope expression against specified . An atomic expression is an expression that does not contain scope operators and grouping parentheses.

member.summary: Tests if a scope name matches a pattern.

A single scope name, with parts seperated by dot

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Theming.ComplexScopeMap
member.summary: Map all scopes that end with SimpleScopeName to a Settings (and from there to a ClassificationTag).

remarks.para:
A ComplexScopeMap contains the information to map something like:
foo.bar => blue baz foo.bar => red foobar foo.bar => green
(in this case, _simpleSettings would be blue and _complexSettings would contain two elements.

The GetClassificationTag() method first checks to see if there's a match in _complexScopes. If that fails, _simpleSettings is used if non-null. If that fails, then we check to see if there's a ComplexScopeMap for the truncated SimpleScopeName (in this case, "foo").

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Theming.ComplexScopeMap.IsAncestorOF(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Theming.ComplexScopeMap)
member.summary: Is an ancestor of this. "foo.bar" would be considered an ancestor of "foo.bar.baz".

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextMate.Core.Theming.TMTheme
member.summary: This classes the theme associated with a specific grammar. Most grammars will not have a theme so we fallback to the base theme (which is picked based on the VSTheme (light, dark, blue, etc.).
